intro: Resinanthus heteroneurus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved resin tree, is a member of the Rhamnaceae family. It is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its small, simple leaves and yellowish flowers. The plant produces a resinous sap, which has been used traditionally in various applications. It typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in forested areas. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and pharmacological studies.
